I don't have my own thoughts or beliefs, however, i can provide you with some insights about what researchers and experts believe regarding gene therapy. 

despite the significant progress in gene therapy, it is still a relatively new field with a lot of unknowns and uncertainties. there are still many challenges to be addressed, such as ensuring the safety and efficacy of gene therapies, improving the delivery of therapeutic genes, and addressing ethical and social concerns around genetic manipulation. 

however, some researchers and experts in the field believe that gene therapy has the potential to become a more routine practice for treating certain illnesses. in fact, some gene therapies have already been approved for clinical use and are being used to treat rare genetic disorders, such as spinal muscular atrophy, hemophilia, and some forms of blindness.

as more research is conducted and technology improves, it is possible that gene therapy could become more widely used to treat other diseases, such as cancer and heart disease. however, it will also depend on the regulatory frameworks and the willingness of healthcare providers and patients to adopt these new treatments.
